One of the worlds most important open source licenses, originally developed for BSD Unix. It is very liberal: Basically it allows you to redistribute both sources and binaries, as you want. Unlike the GPL you may even sell derivated works. See also
http://www.opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php.

JAXB (http://java.sun.com/xml/jaxb/) is the SUN specification for Java/XML binding. It is also available as a reference implementation. JaxMe aims to become another JAXB implementation at some time. However, full JAXB support is far from complete.
